page.title: 01Colerne and District
page.content:
Within this twelve kilometre block there is the main part of the village of Colerne, part of Slaughterford village, the hamlet of Thickwood and Colerne airfield which now includes Azimghur Barracks which is the base for Junior Leaders' Regiment R.C.T..
Colerne is a hill village, 500 feet above sea level, on an outlying spur of the Cotswolds. The old village, which has been declared a conservation area, is in the Cotswolds style and includes a 13th century Church and a number of buildings listed as being of architectural or historical interest.
The surounding farmland is mainly used for cereal crops and grass for livestock. Part of the area has been designated as an area of outstanding natural beauty.
